Posts.Content: Hi Mightymouse Don't despair just yet. I had my expander replaced with a permanent implant and a reduction on the other side three weeks ago. When I saw the reduced side first I could have cried!! It looked wonky and misshapen. However it now looks amazing and I'm thrilled with the results, your body has been through a lot it may just need to settle  All the best  Sarah
Posts.Title: Navel gazing

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzie,  I haven't read the article and I'm not sure I want to after seeing how it has made you feel. What I can tell you is I had my final chemo on Monday. While it hasn't been fun it has been entirely manageable. I have got three young children and have managed to carry on as normal as far as they are concerned. I didn't cold cap so can't help you there, but if I have wanted to do something then I have within the advice given. Yes there are days when I feel rubbish but there have been more days when I have felt normal. Please don't let this worry you before your own journey has started Sending hugs Sarah xx
Posts.Title: Decca Aitkenhead in the Guardian

Posts.Content: This is me wearing my £67 NHS wig. I've been wearing it since starting chemo in Feb and hardly anyone has realised including the nurses on chemo suite who offered me the cold cap every time I turned up!! It has been great to maintain normality for my kids
Posts.Title: Rage at the Wigs!
